creative_patterns: Use of fast-paced edits to maintain viewer attention.
Incorporation of text overlays with catchy, relatable phrases.
Integration of trending sounds to enhance viewer engagement.
Frequent use of jump cuts to keep the content dynamic.
Implementation of POV (point-of-view) perspectives to make content more relatable.
Adoption of storytelling with a clear beginning, middle, and end within a 15-30 second timeframe.
Utilization of split-screen effects to compare products or ideas.
Leveraging augmented reality effects for a futuristic feel.
Use of reaction-based content to connect emotionally with the audience.
Incorporating bloopers or outtakes to add authenticity.
Use of time-lapse effects to show quick progression or completion of tasks.
Adoption of minimalist visual aesthetics to focus attention on the main message.
Creating rhythm by coordinating scene changes with music beats.
Presenting user testimonials or reviews in the form of short snippets.
Integrating challenges or calls-to-action that encourage viewer participation.
cadence_rules: Maintain a fast pace throughout the video to keep viewers engaged.
Use edits that introduce a new scene or piece of information every 1-3 seconds.
Overlay text should appear briefly (under 2 seconds) with clear and concise messages.
Align visual transitions to the beat of background music or sound effects.
Begin with an attention-grabbing scene within the first 3 seconds.
Utilize countdowns or timer overlays to create a sense of urgency.
Ensure audio clarity by minimizing background noise and emphasizing key sounds.
Use varying shot distances (close-up, medium, wide) to keep visual interest.
Insert scene changes or effects every 3-5 seconds to maintain dynamism.
Incorporate seamless looping so the end of the video connects smoothly with the beginning.
do_not_do: Avoid overly lengthy introductions that cause viewer drop-off.
Do not use cluttered visuals where key messages are lost.
Refrain from using text that is too small or moves too quickly to read.
Avoid relying on a single scene or static image for too long.
Do not use copyrighted music without permission as it can lead to video removal.
Avoid excessive use of clashing visual filters.
Don't repeat the same information or scene excessively within the same video.
Refrain from making videos longer than 60 seconds unless necessary for context.
Do not ignore sound quality; ensure dialogue and important sounds are audible.
Avoid misleading viewers with inaccurate or over-exaggerated claims.
Do not overload videos with text blocks; keep it succinct and impactful.
Avoid transitions that are too jarring or distract from the message.
Don't neglect accessibility; ensure subtitles are available when dialogue is present.
Do not use default platform fonts for overlays; opt for custom fonts to stand out.
